verses.kjv: On that day did the king Ahasuerus give the house of Haman the Jews’ enemy unto Esther the queen. And Mordecai came before the king; for Esther had told what he was unto her.
verses.ct: That same day, King Ahasuerus gave the entire estate of Haman, the enemy of the Jews, to Queen Esther. Mordecai was brought into the king's presence, because Esther had revealed how he was related to her.

verses.kjv: And the king took off his ring, which he had taken from Haman, and gave it unto Mordecai. And Esther set Mordecai over the house of Haman.
verses.ct: The king removed his signet ring, which he had reclaimed from Haman, and presented it to Mordecai. Esther then put Mordecai in charge of Haman's estate.

verses.kjv: And Esther spake yet again before the king, and fell down at his feet, and besought him with tears to put away the mischief of Haman the Agagite, and his device that he had devised against the Jews.
verses.ct: Esther spoke to the king again, falling at his feet and weeping as she pleaded with him to undo the evil scheme that Haman the Agagite had plotted against the Jews.

verses.kjv: Then the king held out the golden sceptre toward Esther. So Esther arose, and stood before the king,
verses.ct: The king extended the golden scepter toward Esther, so she got up and stood in his presence.

verses.kjv: And said, If it please the king, and if I have found favour in his sight, and the thing seem right before the king, and I be pleasing in his eyes, let it be written to reverse the letters devised by Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, which he wrote to destroy the Jews which are in all the king’s provinces:
verses.ct: She said, "If it pleases the king, and if I have earned his approval, and if this seems like the right thing to do, and if I am acceptable to him, let an order be written to cancel the documents crafted by Haman son of Hammedatha the Agagite — the ones he wrote to wipe out the Jews throughout every province of the kingdom.

verses.kjv: For how can I endure to see the evil that shall come unto my people? or how can I endure to see the destruction of my kindred?
verses.ct: "How could I bear to watch disaster fall on my people? How could I stand to witness the destruction of my relatives?"

verses.kjv: Then the king Ahasuerus said unto Esther the queen and to Mordecai the Jew, Behold, I have given Esther the house of Haman, and him they have hanged upon the gallows, because he laid his hand upon the Jews.
verses.ct: King Ahasuerus replied to Queen Esther and Mordecai the Jew, "Look — I have already given Haman's estate to Esther, and they have hanged him on the gallows because he tried to attack the Jews.

verses.kjv: Write ye also for the Jews, as it liketh you, in the king’s name, and seal it with the king’s ring: for the writing which is written in the king’s name, and sealed with the king’s ring, may no man reverse.
verses.ct: "Now you may write whatever you see fit on behalf of the Jews, using the king's name, and seal it with the king's ring. Because any document written in the king's name and sealed with the king's ring cannot be overturned by anyone."

verses.kjv: Then were the king’s scribes called at that time in the third month, that is, the month Sivan, on the three and twentieth day thereof; and it was written according to all that Mordecai commanded unto the Jews, and to the lieutenants, and the deputies and rulers of the provinces which are from India unto Ethiopia, an hundred twenty and seven provinces, unto every province according to the writing thereof, and unto every people after their language, and to the Jews according to their writing, and according to their language.
verses.ct: The king's scribes were summoned at that time — on the 23rd day of the 3rd month, the month of Sivan. Everything Mordecai dictated was written down and sent to the Jews, the governors, the regional officials, and the rulers of the 127 provinces stretching from India to Ethiopia. Each province received the message in its own script, each people group in its own language, and the Jews in their own script and language.

verses.kjv: And he wrote in the king Ahasuerus’ name, and sealed it with the king’s ring, and sent letters by posts on horseback, and riders on mules, camels, and young dromedaries:
verses.ct: Mordecai wrote in the name of King Ahasuerus, sealed the documents with the king's ring, and dispatched them through mounted couriers riding fast horses, mules, camels, and young racing camels.

verses.kjv: Wherein the king granted the Jews which were in every city to gather themselves together, and to stand for their life, to destroy, to slay, and to cause to perish, all the power of the people and province that would assault them, both little ones and women, and to take the spoil of them for a prey,
verses.ct: In these letters, the king authorized the Jews in every city to organize and defend themselves — to destroy, kill, and wipe out any armed force from any people or province that might attack them, including their women and children, and to seize their property as plunder.

verses.kjv: Upon one day in all the provinces of king Ahasuerus, namely, upon the thirteenth day of the twelfth month, which is the month Adar.
verses.ct: This was to take place on a single day throughout all the provinces of King Ahasuerus — the 13th day of the 12th month, the month of Adar.

verses.kjv: The copy of the writing for a commandment to be given in every province was published unto all people, and that the Jews should be ready against that day to avenge themselves on their enemies.
verses.ct: A copy of this decree was to be issued as law in every province and made public to all peoples, so that the Jews would be prepared on that day to take vengeance on their enemies.

verses.kjv: So the posts that rode upon mules and camels went out, being hastened and pressed on by the king’s commandment. And the decree was given at Shushan the palace.
verses.ct: The couriers, riding mules and camels, raced out urgently, driven by the king's command. The decree was also proclaimed in the fortress of Shushan.

verses.kjv: And Mordecai went out from the presence of the king in royal apparel of blue and white, and with a great crown of gold, and with a garment of fine linen and purple: and the city of Shushan rejoiced and was glad.
verses.ct: Mordecai left the king's presence wearing royal robes of blue and white, a large golden crown, and a outer cloak of fine linen and purple. The city of Shushan erupted in celebration and joy.

verses.kjv: The Jews had light, and gladness, and joy, and honour.
verses.ct: For the Jews, there was light, happiness, joy, and honor.

verses.kjv: And in every province, and in every city, whithersoever the king’s commandment and his decree came, the Jews had joy and gladness, a feast and a good day. And many of the people of the land became Jews; for the fear of the Jews fell upon them.
verses.ct: In every province and every city where the king's command and decree reached, the Jews celebrated with joy, feasting, and a holiday. Many people throughout the land converted and became Jews, because dread of the Jews had gripped them.
